title: Author's Afterword
content:
Author's Afterword

THIS IS KINUGASA, who, as of this November, has finally hit a major milestone.

From age 19 to 40. It seems that before I knew it, I had dedicated more than half my life to writing.

I'm a proper old man now. An age that was once called the beginning of old age. Truly, I am old.

However, the fact that I'm able to continue my work is all thanks to you. Thank you all so very much.

With Volume 3 being the Uninhabited Island arc, I wonder if anyone was actually hoping for girls in swimsuits?

Sorry! No such luck!

But, maybe there will be next time (then again, maybe not).

And so, I'll let you keep your hopes up, as the answer will be carried over to Volume 4.

This volume's story was spread a bit thin across the entire third year, but while the framework for the next volume will also involve a large group, the plan is for a special exam that will focus on a much smaller cast of characters.

There will be new meetings and partings, and it will be one of the major turning points of the third-year arc, so I hope you'll look forward to it.

Now, that was a look at this volume and a preview of the next...

I have one important announcement to make here.

While I've managed to somehow push my body past its limits until now, recently, in order to maintain the publication pace, I've been continuously placing a great burden on my family and all related parties.

Even with the writing of this third volume, honestly, I'm amazed we managed to get it ready for release...

It was a daily, grueling battle, to the point that I don't think I could ever do it again.

While I've managed to persevere this far with a great deal of support, I have concluded that trying to maintain this pace would not only cause further trouble and worry for those around me, but also fatally impact the work's quality more than ever before. Therefore, with the release of this third volume, I have decided to allow myself a little more time for the next release.

Normally, the next volume would be out at the end of March, but instead it will be at the end of April, one month later, or the end of May, two months later.

I cannot state anything for certain right now, but I intend to aim for the earliest possible return.

I apologize for the inconvenience to all of you who are eagerly waiting, and I ask for your understanding.

It's a bit early to be saying this, but let's meet again in 2026. See you then!
